verbs.description: choose (third-person singular simple present chooses, present participle choosing, simple past chose or (nonstandard) choosed, past participle chosen or (nonstandard) choosed or (now colloquial) chose)

entries.meaning: To pick; to make the choice of; to select.
examples: I chose a nice ripe apple from the fruit bowl.
He was chosen as president in 1990.

entries.meaning: To decide to act in a certain way.
examples: I chose to walk to work today.

entries.meaning: To prefer; to wish; to desire.
examples: Choose truth, and find beauty. Choose love, and embrace change.

description: From Middle English chose, chos, chooce, a Northern dialectal form of Middle English chois (â€œchoiceâ€). Cognate with Scots chose, choose, chuse (â€œchoosing, choice, selectionâ€). Doublet of choice, which see for more.

entries.meaning: (obsolete, Northern England, Scotland) The act of choosing; selection.
(obsolete, Northern England, Scotland) The power, right, or privilege of choosing; election.
